page.title: 14DARENTH VIADUCT - S. DARENTH
page.content: The viaduct runs east-west across the Darenth Valley at S. Darenth, and carries two railway tracks on the line from London (Victoria) to Dover. It consists of 10 arches, each approx. 10 metres wide by 20 metres high above water level. As one faces south, the 3rd and 6th arches span the Horton Road and R.Darent respectively, while the 8th passes over a road leading to a small industrial estate. The first 3 arches are reinforced with iron ties, 3 to each spandrel. The viaduct, designed by the engineer Joseph Cubitts, was built in 1859-60 by teams of Irish 'navvies' for the London, Chatham & Dover Rail- way. The contracters were Peto, Betts & Crampton. Today, the viaduct carries a total of 162 passenger trains, as well as 3 freight trains, to and from London every day.
